name: hannah
text: there was only one instrument for cartilidge head.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: The theramin would be too small and newfangled, and a harp sounds too pretty, therefore musical saw.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: mind you the theremin was invented 1928 so its not that newfangled, but it is in principle

name: landowmpg
text: A custom job, of course, with his initials on the inside of the box (also on the food place-card, but that's beside the point).  Pure class.

name: turnabout
text: A comment left by turnabout was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, Yossarian, kenthegod, Hendetta, nutmeg)

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Ray is taking in the flavors and emotions of fine, fine wine.

name: petitegitan
text: This is exactly what I was going to say.  Well put dropkickpikachu.

name: jesler729
text: Yes, but why does it turn clear after he takes that first sip?

name: gormster
text: He finished it in one gulp. It is that delicious.

name: waldo913
text: It isn't like regular wine. Much like the strange enchantment of Cartilage Head's performance, it starts as a strange and mystical bouquet of intensity and quickly fades into a descent of bitter emptiness and sorrow.

name: jesler729
text: Dang

name: cpnglxynchos
text: too. right. wow, man you nailed it.

name: budenhagen
text: Nah, I think Onstad just forgot to color it in.

name: waldo913
text: On all six subsequent panels featuring that glass?

name: scorpio_nadir
text: On purpose. Ray drank the flavor, the remainder is just liquid. It is Cartilage Head's special vintage.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: YES.

name: bpmead
text: I might cite you in my Cartilage Head essay for my college writing class.

name: waldo913
text: I'd be honored.

name: greenkoolayd
text: like trent reznors volvo of dispair...

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
by why the presence of the banana, coffee beans, strawberries, and apples/green peppers? these things rarely find their way into most wines.

perhaps the wine is so good that it gives you the flavors of all its fallen plant kingdom brethren, present or otherwise.

name: jackparsons
text: They find their way into the wines of Cartilage Head because Cartilage Head wants it that way.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: A comment left by cpnglxynchos was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Mangtastic, atticusonline, Satyr)

name: relaxing
text:
To quote wikipedia:

"Wines may be classified by their primary impression on the drinker's palate. They are made up of chemical compounds which are similar or identical to those in fruits, vegetables, and spices.

Specific flavors may also be sensed, due to the highly complex mix of organic molecules such as esters and terpenes that grape juice and wine can contain. Tasters will also distinguish between flavors characteristic of a specific grape (e.g., Cabernet Sauvignon and blackcurrant) and flavors that are imparted by other factors in wine making, either intentional or not. The most typical intentional flavor elements in wine are those that are imparted by aging in oak casks, and virtually every element of chocolate, vanilla, or coffee is actually a factor of oak and not the native grape.

Banana flavors (isoamyl acetate) are the product of yeast metabolism."

name: unright
text: You can find those flavors in wine. Probably not all in the same wine, but individually those falvors are not unheard of.

name: goatmasterflash
text: Wine is made entirely from grapes, only to be described by people as all "essence of _____ with notes of _____", where _____ equals anything and everything...except grapes.

name: belgand
text: Saying it tastes like that old grape juice in the back of the fridge that someone added some cheap jug vodka to just doesn't make you any friends. People think this on their own sometimes, but they're just afraid to say it.

name: cagliostro
text:
And yet, bizarrely, saying it tastes like cat's piss is regarded as a) the sign of an exceptionally distinguished palate, and b) a point in the wine's favour.

Me, I like cheap plonk from Sainsbury's, because no-one expects you to appreciate the full, ripe body and impertinent nose.

name: belgand
text: I do not drink alcohol, but this can of Mt. Dew has notes of awesomeness and a finish of keeping me awake after staying up all night for no damn good reason.

name: dtuba
text: Meh, I'm like the Thomas Haden Church character from Sideways. It all tastes like wine to me.

name: c_dizzle
text: A fine inverse wine. Lest we forget.

name: c_dizzle
text: goddamn BBcode! Always gets me.

name: apricotta
text: It looks more like html to me.

name: cailetshadow
text: Fruit of the Loom fine undergarments sponsors this strip.

name: habnabit
text: That is totally what I thought too.

name: senseihollywood
text:
Cartilage Head wine? I'm down...

Hey Mr. Onstead...this would fly...let's make it happen...seriously

name: hellofyellin
text:
senseihollywood...

He gets things done.

name: littlefatdog
text: saws are crazy sounding. like "ooooobleydoobleydoo". they account for the crazy wobbly sounds in the background of a lot of neutral milk hotel songs

name: gormster
text: Played with a bow, though, they sound incredibly creepy. Like a violin that saw terrible, terrible things.

name: spinynorman
text:
I imagine this entire strip being played to the background of "November" by Tom Waits.

Yeah. Yeah, I listen to way too much Tom. What the fuck can you do, man. I got a rash man.

name: hellofditties
text: I only chubbied you 'cause you mentioned NMH.  Is that wrong..?

name: charchar
text: I think I found a soundtrack for this arc

name: mr_lostman28
text: holy crap... I think I cried.

name: heccibiggs
text: Chubby for so accurately conveying the sound of wobbling a saw, even if it was slightly inaccurate in reference to this strip.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: a duet with theremin would be a wonderful strange thing.

name: dhinson
text: Anyone care to lend a thought on the Alt Text?  Saw sounds?

name: connellingus
text: It's German. "Coffee, strawberry, banana, grape, cinnamon. Coffee, strawberry, banana, grape, cinnamon. Coffee, strawberry, banana, grape, cinnamon. Also apple."

name: ttagxamm
text:
Wine flavors, as mentioned above and as illustrated in panel two.

The musical saw, I imagine, sounds a bit like "Saeterjentens Sondag" . The accordion player sits behind an elegant folding screen. What seems to be the ghostly crackles and pops of an old 78 is just the sound of Cartilage Head breathing.

name: zeal
text: Several years ago I was treated to a musical saw performance.  It is an amazing instrument, and I highly recommend it to one and all.

name: mr_lostman28
text:
I first read this as "I highly recommend it to no one at all".
I like it better.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: oh come on, it was funny.

name: howl
text: Mostly apple.

name: aki
text: That would be "zum groessten teil Apfel", connellingus got it right (auch = also/additionally).

name: howl
text: I was making a Discworld reference, I'm not trying to correct anybody. I ain't know shit about German.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: so, uh, basically screw you, aki?

name: ojnabieoot
text: I'm reminded of Ulysses, Chapter 14, which describes Bloom visiting the maternity hospital and is written as a weird history of the English language.  It begins with "Deshil Holles Eamus. Deshil Holles Eamus. Deshil Holles Eamus."  I doubt that's what Onstad was getting at, since it's a really far flung reference, but now I can't stop thinking about any possible connection.

name: deusoma
text: "click". Click is never a good sign.

name: dasilodavi
text: Did anyone hear a stream of harp music when they hit panel two?

text: Musical saw is the best thing for Cartilage Head to play. Except I don't really think he even needs to play it to make that sound, he can get it by just moving his rubbery limbs

text: Top ten blog entry. Absolute must-read, manifesto level stuff. Thanks for reminding me of it.

name: greenkoolayd
text: [[raises hand]]

name: diggydow
text: Oh my God, too good...

name: siolre
text:
It's hard for me to read this arc. Cartilage Head is like the most fucked up, nightmarish shit imaginable all focused into one grotesquely creepy dude.

And my chicken soup goes uneaten. D:

name: direhaggis
text: And with a swift ssssup, the wine crashed the monogram gothesque two-step of apartment decor. Driven to pleasure psychosis, Ray found himself in the near middle of a Fruit of the Loom underwear logo, adrift as his mind-sonar echoed in tiny, perfect rings of German.

name: wurlitzergirl
text: Poor misunderstood Cartilage Head. I bet he plays the musical saw beautifully. I'd be his friend.

name: sabbac
text: The wine changes from red to white?

name: gopacapulco
text: i love cartilage head!

name: riotdejaneiro
text: I laughed so hard at this that I got a headache...just look at those faces . Both Cartilage and Ray. So funny yet so horrifying

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i feel awkward eating in front of people that aren't.

until today, i thought CH was eating as well, so i was going to comment in wonder of the music still being played...but there is no need for that anymore, for i am now the see-saw.
